co.vandenham.telegram.botapi

Class TelegramBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.vandenham.telegram.botapi.TelegramBot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatContextTelegramBot, RegistrableTelegramBot

    public abstract class TelegramBot
extends Object
    This class represents a TelegramBot.

    To use it, use any of the available subclasses or subclass it yourself.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TelegramBot(String botToken)
      Convenience constructor for TelegramBot(botToken, true)
      TelegramBot(String botToken, boolean sendAsync)
      Constructs a TelegramBot using the provided botToken, If sendAsync is true, the bot invokes all sendXXX methods asynchronously.

      • TelegramBot

        public TelegramBot(String botToken)
        Convenience constructor for TelegramBot(botToken, true)

      • TelegramBot

        public TelegramBot(String botToken,
                   boolean sendAsync)
        Constructs a TelegramBot using the provided botToken, If sendAsync is true, the bot invokes all sendXXX methods asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        botToken - The token provided by @BotFather
        sendAsync - Whether this bot should invoke sendXXX methods asynchronously.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts the bot.

        First, it instantiates a ExecutorService by calling provideExecutorService(). If this instance is constructed with sendAsync set to true, it instantiates a asynchronous ApiRequestExecutor, otherwise a synchronous version is used.

        After this, a polling Thread is instantiated and the bot starts polling the Telegram API.

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stops the bot and joins the polling Thread.

      • onStop

        protected void onStop()

      • provideExecutorService

        protected ExecutorService provideExecutorService()
        Instantiates and returns an ExecutorService.

        By default, Executors.newCachedThreadPool() is used. This method can safely be overridden to adjust this behaviour. This method can safely be overridden to return null, but if you decide to do so, notifyNewMessages(List) must be overridden to avoid a NPE.

        Returns:
        An instantiated ExecutorService

      • forwardMessage

        public final ApiResponse<Message> forwardMessage(int chatId,
                                                 int fromChatId,
                                                 int messageId)
        Forwards a message with ID messageId from fromChatId to chatId.
        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient — User or GroupChat id
        fromChatId - Unique identifier for the chat where the original message was sent — User or GroupChat id
        messageId - Unique message identifier
        Returns:
        An ApiResponse with the sent Message
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#forwardmessage

      • getMe

        public final ApiResponse<User> getMe()
        A simple method for testing your bot's auth token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.
        Returns:
        this bot's information, in the form of a User wrapped in a ApiResponse
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme

                                                                 OptionalArgs optionalArgs)

        For any optional arguments, refer to the Telegram documentation.

        Parameters:
        userId - Unique identifier of the target user
        optionalArgs - Any optional arguments for this method
        Returns:
        The requested UserProfilePhotos
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getuserprofilephotos, OptionalArgs

      • sendAudio

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendAudio(int chatId,
                                            File audioFile)
        See Also:
        sendAudio(int, File, OptionalArgs)

      • sendAudio

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendAudio(int chatId,
                                            File audioFile,
                                            OptionalArgs optionalArgs)
        Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display them in the music player. Your audio must be in the .mp3 format. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future. For backward compatibility, when the fields title and performer are both empty and the mime-type of the file to be sent is not audio/mpeg, the file will be sent as a playable voice message. For this to work, the audio must be in an .ogg file encoded with OPUS. This behavior will be phased out in the future. For sending voice messages, use the sendVoice method instead. For any optional arguments, refer to the Telegram documentation.
        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient - User or GroupChat id
        audioFile - Audio File to send
        optionalArgs - Any optional arguments for this method
        Returns:
        The sent Message
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendaudio

      • sendAudio

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendAudio(int chatId,
                                            String audioFileId)
        See Also:
        sendAudio(int, String, OptionalArgs)

      • sendAudio

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendAudio(int chatId,

        See Also:

      • sendChatAction

        public final ApiResponse<Boolean> sendChatAction(int chatId,
                                                 ChatAction chatAction)
        Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status).
        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient - User or GroupChat id.
        chatAction - The target ChatAction
        Returns:
        True if the request was successful
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendchataction

                                               File documentFile)
        See Also:
        sendAudio(int, File, OptionalArgs)

      • sendDocument

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendDocument(int chatId,
                                               File documentFile,
                                               OptionalArgs optionalArgs)
        Use this method to send general files. On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send files of any type of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

        For any optional arguments, refer to the Telegram documentation.

        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient - User or GroupChat id
        documentFile - File to send
        optionalArgs - Any optional arguments
        Returns:
        The sent Message
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#senddocument

      • sendVideo

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendVideo(int chatId,
                                            File videoFile,
                                            OptionalArgs optionalArgs)
        Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support mp4 videos (other formats may be sent as Document (sendDocument(int, File, OptionalArgs))). Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

        For any optional arguments, refer to the Telegram documentation.

        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient - User or GroupChat id
        videoFile - Video to send
        optionalArgs - Any optional arguments.
        Returns:
        The sent Message
        See Also:
        https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sendvideo

      • sendVoice

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendVoice(int chatId,
                                            File voiceFile)
        See Also:
        sendVoice(int, File, OptionalArgs)

      • sendVoice

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendVoice(int chatId,
                                            File voiceFile,
                                            OptionalArgs optionalArgs)
        Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .ogg file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Audio or Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future. For any optional arguments, refer to the Telegram documentation.
        Parameters:
        chatId - Unique identifier for the message recipient — User or GroupChat id
        voiceFile - Audio file to send. You can either pass a file_id as String to resend an audio that is already on the Telegram servers, or upload a new audio file using multipart/form-data.
        optionalArgs - Any optional arguments
        Returns:
        the sent Message

      • sendVoice

        public final ApiResponse<Message> sendVoice(int chatId,
                                            String voiceFileId)
        This version uses a String rather than a File.
        See Also:

      • onMessage

        protected void onMessage(Message message)
        This method is called when a new message has arrived. It can safely be overridden by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        message - The newly arrived Message

      • notifyNewMessages

        protected void notifyNewMessages(List<Message> messages)
        This method is called by this class to process all new Messages asynchronously. It must be overridden if provideExecutorService() is overridden to return null, otherwise a NullPointerException may be thrown.
        Parameters:
        messages - The newly arrived Messages
